--- In junit@y..., Scott Stirling <sstirling@m...> wrote:
> This is really interesting and cool.

This is also my opinion, thanks! :-)

> No source available?

The source will be available at a later version. Currently it does
not make sense because the whole internal stuff changes quite a lot.
At least the MockController will not change so much so that the
current users of this package won't be disappointened.
 
> Anyway, it looks to me like the use of dynamic proxies allows you 
to create
> an object instance from a interface definition.

Yeah, this is the feature I use internally.

> And then you've added the
> ability to modify the state of the object, or at least mimic the 
behavior of
> an object via your MockController.

Actually, the whole MockController switches state,
and the InvocationHandler for the mock object delegates
its calls to the mock controller. So when the mock controller
switches its state, the behaviour of the mock switches
automagically.

But if you ask this question again in a week,
it is very likely that the answer will have changed. :-|

Thank you for your interest,
